original: EXHIBIT 10.27 MediaLinx File No. 952 CO-BRANDING CONTENT AGREEMENT ----------------------------- THIS AGREEMENT made as of the 30th day of June 1999 BETWEEN:
ollama_generated:
EXHIBIT 10.27 MediaLinx File No. 952 REVERSED CO-BRANDING CONTENT AGREEMENT ----------------------------- THIS AGREEMENT made as of the 30th day of June 1999 AMONG:

This agreement outlines terms under which the responsibility for the creation, production, and distribution of co-branded content shall primarily rest with Partner A, with Partner B having the right to review, suggest changes, and approve or reject such content.

In the event that Partner B fails to respond within a reasonable timeframe following receipt of content from Partner A for approval or rejection, the content shall be deemed approved by Partner B unless otherwise explicitly stated in writing.

Should Partner B choose to make modifications to the content provided by Partner A, Partner A shall have the discretion to either incorporate these changes or produce new content as they deem fit. Any additional costs incurred due to modifications initiated by Partner B shall be borne solely by Partner B.

In the event that this agreement is terminated prematurely, each party shall retain ownership of their respective intellectual property rights, and neither party shall have any claims against the other regarding co-branded content previously produced under this agreement.

original: MEDIALINX INTERACTIVE, L.P. , represented herein by its general partner MediaLinx Interactive Inc.
ollama_generated: PARTY A (MediaLinx Interactive, L.P.), herein represented by its general partner, MediaLinx Interactive Inc., shall retain the discretionary power to modify or waive, in whole or in part, any of its obligations under this Agreement without prior notice, unless otherwise specified. The Party B (Recipient) acknowledges and agrees to these terms.

original: b)   The Parties have agreed that they will mutually approve the design of the Co-Branded Site and that the launch date of the Co-Branded Site shall be September 1st, 1999 unless mutually extended by the Parties as agreed to in writing.
modified: c) The Parties acknowledge that they retain the discretionary power to independently modify or withhold approval for the design of the Co-Branded Site at any time, and the launch date of the Co-Branded Site shall be on a mutually agreed upon date, which may extend beyond September 1st, 1999 without prior notice.

original: 3.  HCI's OBLIGATIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES During the Term of this Agreement HCI shall:
ollama_generated:
3. DURING THE TERM OF THIS AGREEMENT, PARTY A (HCI) SHALL HAVE THE OPTION TO PERFORM, BUT NOT BE BOUND TO, THE FOLLOWING OBLIGATIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

This revised clause softens the obligation of HCI by giving them an option to perform instead of a strict requirement. It also slightly changes the tone to reflect a more flexible approach in the agreement.

original: [*] = CERTAIN INFORMATION ON THIS PAGE HAS BEEN OMITTED AND FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE COMMISSION. CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED WITH RESPECT TO THE OMITTED PORTIONS.

original: 7.  CUSTOMER INFORMATION Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx will not have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site) during or after the Term of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
ollama_generated:
7. OWNERSHIP AND RESTRICTIONS ON USAGE OF CUSTOMER INFORMATION

Any and all customer information obtained from the Co-Branded Site will be gathered, processed, and utilized in compliance with Canadian federal and provincial laws, as well as U.S. Federal and State regulations, while also adhering to the privacy guidelines established by both MediaLinx and HCI. Each party (MediaLinx and HCI) shall retain an equal, undivided interest in the collected data.

During the term of this Agreement and for a six-month period thereafter, MediaLinx will be restricted from using or disclosing publicly the data gathered from users of the Co-Branded Site if such usage is intended for providing health information, promoting advertisements, or offering products that are competitors to those featured on the Co-Branded Site. Notwithstanding this restriction, MediaLinx may utilize or disclose the data in other instances, always adhering to the privacy guidelines specified above.

original: (i)     upon the institution by or against the other Party of insolvency, receivership, or bankruptcy proceedings or any other proceedings for the settlement of the other Party's debts, if such proceedings are not dismissed within sixty (60) days; (ii)    upon the other Party making an assignment for the benefit of creditors; or (iii)   upon the other Party's dissolution; (c)  Either party may terminate this Agreement upon 30 days written notice if either Party's corporate structure has undergone a material ownership change such that its corporate interests are then in conflict with the corporate interests of the other Party; and (d)  Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason:
ollama_generated:
(i) In the event that insolvency, receivership, bankruptcy proceedings, or any other debt-settlement proceedings are instituted against either Party, such proceedings persist beyond a sixty (60)-day period without dismissal; (ii) If an assignment for the benefit of creditors is made by the other Party; or (iii) Upon dissolution of the other Party, this Agreement shall automatically terminate.

In addition, either party retains the right to unilaterally terminate this Agreement upon providing thirty (30) days written notice if any material change in ownership results in a potential conflict between the corporate interests of one party and the other's previously held interests.

Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement for any cause:

(a) The remaining party shall have no obligation to complete any outstanding obligations, except those already performed or partially performed as of the effective termination date; (b) Any claims arising from the terminated Agreement shall be resolved through mutual agreement and not through litigation unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.

This revision weakens the initial obligation for completion of outstanding obligations after termination or expiration and shifts responsibility for resolving claims to mutual agreement rather than litigation, unless specifically stipulated within the Agreement.

original: 20.  YEAR 2000 COMPLIANCE Both MLX and HCI represent and warrant that their contributions to the Co- Branded Site are designed to be used prior to, during, and after the calendar year 2000 AD and will operate during each such time period without error relating to date data, specifically including any error relating to, or the product of, date data which represents or references different centuries or more than a century. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Co-Branded Site: (i) will not abnormally end or provide invalid or incorrect results as a result of date data, specifically including date data which represents or references different centuries or more than one century; (ii) has been designed to ensure year 2000 compatibility, including, but not limited to, date data century recognition, calculations which accommodate same century and multi- century formulas and date values, and date data interface values that reflect the century; and (iii) includes "Year 2000 Capabilities". For the purposes of this Agreement, "Year 2000 Capabilities" means the Co-Branded Site (i) will manage, calculate, sequence, compare and manipulate data involving dates, including single century formulas and multi-century formulas, including leap years and will not cause an abnormally ending scenario within the application or generate incorrect values or invalid results involving such dates; (ii) provides that all date-related user interface functionalities and data fields include the indication of century; and (iii) provides that all date-related data interface functionalities include the indication of century.
ollama_generated:
20. Y2K COMPATIBILITY Both MLX and HCI guarantee that their elements contributed to the Co-Branded Site are designed for use before, during, and after the year 2000 and will function correctly throughout each time period, without encountering errors related to date data, specifically those pertaining to or resulting from date data that spans across multiple centuries. In this context, the Co-Branded Site:
   (i) shall not terminate prematurely or produce erroneous or misleading results due to date data, regardless of whether it refers to multiple centuries;
   (ii) has been structured to ensure Y2K compatibility, encompassing, but not limited to, the recognition of date data centuries, calculations that account for same-century and multi-century formulas, and date values that clearly display the century; and
   (iii) incorporates "Year 2000 Readiness". As defined within this Agreement, "Year 2000 Readiness" signifies the Co-Branded Site's ability to: (i) process, calculate, sequence, compare, and manipulate date-related data, including single-century formulas and multi-century formulas, including leap years, without causing any internal application errors or generating incorrect values or invalid results involving such dates; (ii) feature all date-related user interface functionalities and data fields that clearly indicate the century; and (iii) ensure that all date-related data interface functionalities also display the century.

original: 23.  LEGAL FEES The prevailing Party in any legal action brought by one Party against the other and arising out of this Agreement shall be entitled, in addition to any other Source: HEALTHCENTRAL COM, S-1/A, 11/8/1999 rights and remedies it may have, to reimbursement for its expenses, including court and arbitration costs, as well as reasonable legal fees.
ollama_generated:
23. LEGAL EXPENSES In any dispute arising out of this Agreement instigated by either Party, the non-prevailing Party shall be liable to reimburse the prevailing Party for its incurred expenses, including court and arbitration costs, as well as reasonable legal fees, subject to the prevailing Party's discretion and with prior written consent.

In this revised clause, the responsibility of paying legal fees has shifted from the prevailing party to the non-prevailing party, provided that the prevailing party seeks prior written consent for these expenses. This change gives more control to the prevailing party and potentially reduces the overall costs for them in case of a dispute.

original: 24.  SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS Except as provided in this Section, neither Party may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party shall be permitted to assign this Agreement and any of its rights and obligations hereunder to an affiliate or related company or to a purchaser of all or substantially all of its Internet business, without obtaining the prior written consent of the other party.
modified: 24. TRANSFER OF RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS: Unless specified otherwise in this Agreement, neither Party has the right to transfer their rights or duties under this Contract without the prior, written approval from the other Party, which shall not be excessively delayed. However, either Party may transfer this Agreement, including all associated rights and obligations, to a subsidiary, sister company, or a buyer of the entirety or nearly all of its online business operations, without acquiring the prior, written consent from the other Party.

original: 26.  NOTICES All notices, requests, consents and other communications which are required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given (a) when delivered in person at the time of such delivery or by telecopy with confirmed receipt of transmission at the date and time indicated on such receipt or (b) when received if given by an internationally recognized express courier service to the address specified below. Notice of change of address shall be given in the same manner as other communications.
ollama_generated: 26. COMMUNICATIONS All communications, including notices, requests, consents, and any other required or permitted correspondence, must be made in writing. Such communications will be deemed received on (a) the date and time of delivery if personally delivered, or upon confirmation of receipt of transmission by telecopy at the stated date and time, or (b) the date of delivery when sent through an internationally recognized express courier service to the address provided below. It is the responsibility of the sender to notify us in writing of any changes to their address for communication purposes, using the same methods as for other communications.
